document_data.name: Byubo
document_data.title: The Padhrasattva of Nyum
document_data.mainbody: '''Byubo''' was the [[Padhrasattva]] of Nyum within the [[Padhran religion]]. "Nyum" was a [[Ra-Khati language|Ra-Khatian]] concept combining spirit, courage, and audaciousness, most similar to [[Wikipedia:Chutzpah|chutzpah]].
document_data.History: In life, Byubo was a follower of the [[Padhra]] and one of those who achieved "eaum", or a state of enlightenment. He ascended to join the Padhra and become a padhrasttva.
document_data.Description: Byubo was often depicted in statuary as a man of comical proportions, with short stubby legs and long gangly arms, displaying a wide and loutish grin.
document_data.Followers: The [[Order of Rainbow Monks]] at the [[Rainbow Monastery]] worshiped Byubo. In exchange for donations to the order, they helped [[pilgrim]]s and travelers passing through the [[Gogrus Chasm]] region of the [[Katakoro Shan]] range in [[Ra-Khati]]. They operated hospices for travelers and transported cargo up the chasm wall.
document_data.Magic Items: ''[[Byubo's Lamp of Audacity]]'', held by the statue of Byubo in the Purple Priory of the Rainbow Monastery, was a potent magical item for those of the Padhran faith.
